description.narrative:
This intervention was based on the decision by the Swedish government on August 21st 2014 that Sida should allocate SEK 35 million to address the humanitarian crisis in Ukraine. The overall goal of the intervention was to provide crisis-affected families with immediate winterization support and mitigate the impact of psychosocial distress and lack of early childhood development and care in the most vulnerable people. The aim was to help vulnerable families with children to prepare for the harsh Ukrainian winter, to buy warm clothes for children, heaters and blankets. The project had three expected results: - To provide crises affected populations with winterization support (target 5000 people). - To provide crises affected children and children from host communities with protection through community based psychosocial support groups (target 240 psychologists, teachers and social workers trained; 40 parents participating in pilot positive parenting programme) - Crisis affected children receive educational and Early Childhood Care and Development (ECCD) services through culturally appropriate recreaional and community based activities (target: 500 boys and girls enrolled in recreational activities; 400 vulnerable children provided with educational support; 5 ECCD units rehabilitated; 4000 back to school kits distributed).
The activity period was 2014.12.01 - 2015.07.31 and Sida's contribution was SEK 7 million.

Övergripande mål: att erbjuda krisdrabbade familjer omedelbart stöd för anpassning till vinterförhållanden och avhjälpa effekten av psykosocial ångest och avsaknad av barnens tidiga utveckling, och vård, hos de mest sårbara människorna. Målområden är Donbassregionen, Dnipropetrovsk, Zaporozhzhia och Kharkiv, och Donetsk om möjligt. 5 000 personer bedöms kunna bli hjälpta.
ANPASSNING TILL VINTERFÖRHÅLLANDEN Projektet avses ge stöd för anpassning till vinterförhållanden åt 5 000 personer. Detta kommer att hjälpa internflyktingar och andra sårbara människor att förbereda sig på ett adekvat vis.
Rädda Barnen Sverige kommer att förmedla ”non-food items” såsom varma kläder, skor, filtar, sängkläder, och eventuellt värmeelement och spisar. Detta kommer att ske genom kontantstöd och/eller kuponger.
SKYDD OCH UTBILDNING Projektet avser att ge psykosocialt stöd till ca 2 000 barn och deras familjer, och att erbjuda 2 000 barn utbildningsaktiviteter.
I november kommer Unicef, med Rädda Barnens stöd, att utföra en utvärdering av behovet för skydd och utbildning, vilken kommer att informera och eventuellt leda till justering av denna insats. Insatsen kommer att innehålla ”psychological first aid training”, det vill säga utbildning inom psykosocialt första hjälpen i de flesta delarna av östra Ukraina. Programmet innehåller komponenter såsom erbjudande av platser som är trygga för barn, föräldrar och lärare utbildas, direkt utbildning av nyckelaktörer av minimistandarder inom skydd av barn
Rädda Barnen kommer också att köpa och tillhandahålla ”tillbaka till skolan”-paket, om ovannämnda utvärdering rekommenderar det. Paketen kommer att innehålla skolväska, pennskrin, papper, skrivblock och hygienartiklar.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Activities within result 1, winterization support for 5000 people, were carried out in Dnipropetrovsk and Zaporizhzhia. Cash (4400 UAH) was distributed to households with two or more children. A total of 5942 beneficiaries were reached which is more than the targeted 5000. This was enabled due to foreign currency exchanges. Results aiming at providing crisis affected children and children from host communities with protection through community based psychosocial groups were also achieved according to plan. 255 psychologists, teachers and social workers were trained on psychosocial support and psychological first aid. Two-day trainings weer organized in Dnipropetrovsk and Zaporizhzhia oblasts (one per region).73 parents participated in a pilot positive parenting programme. Expected result 3 stated that crisis affected children were to receive educational and ECCD services and also here results were achieved in accordance with planning: 517 children enrolled in recreational activities, 11434 children received some kind of educational support; 5 ECCD units were rehabilitated and equipped with furniture, didactic material and stationery and 4000 children from 5th to 11th grade received support throgh back to school kits.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
